00:28 Law enforcement surges to Myrtle Beach to prep for Bikefest Pause

02:16 NAACP officials discuss the traffic loop and monitor any discrimination

00:54 Students and teachers at Calvary Christian School gathered in memory of Jacob Causey

09:13 The story of the North Carolina - South Carolina border

03:58 Batman's ride along with Fort Worth Police Department

article_metadata.news-keywords: issac bailey, isaac, myrtle beach, horry county, christians, faith, homeless, religious, freedom, laws
article_metadata.description: While residents of Myrtle Beach have passionately engaged in debates about the Affordable Care Act and religion and whether a pizza owner in Indiana has a right to decline catering a same-sex wedding, discussing about the proper line between law and religion in this area has been largely muted, even though it has been playing out in Myrtle Beach courts and on Myrtle Beach streets.
article_metadata.title: Why has Myrtle Beach faith community been largely silent on religious freedom conflict? | The Sun News

og.description: While residents of Myrtle Beach have passionately engaged in debates about the Affordable Care Act and religion and whether a pizza owner in Indiana has a right to decline catering a same-sex wedding, discussing about the proper line between law and religion in this area has been largely muted, even though it has been playing out in Myrtle Beach courts and on Myrtle Beach streets.
og.title: Why has Myrtle Beach faith community been largely silent on religious freedom conflict?
